result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Michael Kruchten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. 
-No use or possession of CBD Products. 
-No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

-No violent contact with Victim. 
-Attend Anger Management. 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: -STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 9:56 a.m.
Attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Adam Michael Kruchten.  
Defendant Adam Michael Kruchten in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
90 DAYS JAIL
Sentence to run Consecutive to 22CM177.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: Victim 
Anger Management
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 45-DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Intern Jack Rieder.

If the defendant does not appear at WCS, a Capias will issue and Cash Bail will be $250.00.

10:07 AM Defendant Adam Michael Kruchten in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests another status date in about 30 days.  Court addresses WCS non-compliance reports with defendant.  State requests cash bail in response to WCS non-compliance.  Defense made statements regarding WCS non-compliance and requests bail to remain as set.  Court admonishes defendant regarding WCS compliance and takes no action on bail at this time.  Court sets matter for another status date in September.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
